item.title: A new car is being sold at the same junction as previously reported by the same person. This is the third car for sale in 6 weeks, the other two cars were sold from this site. Therefore the seller is classed as a second hand car dealer and is not permitted to sell from the street. The seller lives locally but has chosen this spot to sell cars as it's on a busy junction with excellent exposure. He is taking up much needed parking spaces for people who live immediately in the road. This is illegal and needs attention., 22nd January
item.description:
Third private car for sale within a short space of time. The seller doesn't even live in the immediate area, he is fairly local but chosen this spot as there is good exposure after selling his other two cars from the same spot. The third car arrived around 1 week ago, and for sale signs are now displayed on the windows with a contact number - as the previous cars.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hythe Avenue, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, 22nd January
item.description:
The potholes in this borough are becoming a joke now These two potholes have been reported numerous times but once again people are still reporting them as nothing once again is being done The rain in the last week has made this extremely deep an wider they are a danger to drivers an public trying to avoid them Use the council tax we pay you to fix them
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chislehurst Road, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mess at end of Floyd Road, 22nd January
item.description:
Masses of black bags around the commercial waste bins. They have been ripped open and rubbish is strewn all over the pavement . This keeps happening so in view of RBG's new crackdown and increased fines for fly tippers this spot is ripe for some CCTV.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charlton Church Lane, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 22nd January
item.description:
There has appeared in the car park with a black sheet covering one of the back passenger sides. Blocking in 2 cars that have been there for at least 10, not road worth, full of rust and yet still sitting there! The car has valid tax but no MOT since 2017. Not sure how that is possible. Cars keep turning up in this area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wadhurst Close, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
